list_definition.definition: a variety of beet with large leaves and thick stalks that is used as a vegetable

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Shred the chard and rinse in a colander under running water.

list_ex_of_english: There are 55 varieties of vegetables grown, including: arugula (rocket), cilantro (coriander), tomatillo, hot peppers, spinach, chard, collards, black kale, berries and lettuce.
Numerous vegetables, notably spinach, chard and rhubarb have a high calcium content, but they may also contain varying amounts of oxalic acid that binds calcium and reduces its absorption.
Other cultivated varieties include the leaf vegetable chard; the sugar beet, used to produce table sugar; and mangelwurzel, which is a fodder crop.
